content: What Greek philosopher, a student of Socrates and teacher of Aristotle, wrote "The Republic" and founded the Academy in Athens?

That would be Plato. He was a key figure in the development of Western philosophy and wrote numerous dialogues, including "The Republic," which outlines his vision for an ideal society governed by philosopher-kings. The Academy he founded was one of the earliest institutions of higher learning in the Western world, and it operated for over 900 years.
